title: Shooting near synagogue in Germany leaves at least two people dead, police say
text:
Police secures the area after a shooting in the eastern German city of Halle on Oct. 9, 2019. (Stringer/Reuters)

A shooting near a synagogue in the eastern German city of Halle left at least two people dead on Wednesday with one suspect taken into custody, local authorities said.

Shots were also fired about 10 miles away from Halle, in the town of Landsberg, according to German media reports.

Police spokeswoman Ulrike Diener said there were reports of injured people in Halle and that multiple suspects were believed to have fled the scene. It was unclear if the shooting was a deliberate attack on Yom Kippur, one of the holiest days of the year in Judaism.

[A German official warned Jews against wearing the kippah. Then he urged all Germans to.]

Anti-Semitic hate crimes have risen significantly in recent years in Germany and other European countries.

On Twitter, authorities urged locals to stay in their homes. The train station in Halle, a city of 240,000, was also closed as a precaution
